title: Why are you writing content for Medium? - Quora

response.answer_text: I began self-publishing on Medium because of 1) Ev Williams’s reputation for success and 2) because of their promise to create a pay-wall system that would finally enable digital writers and self-publishers to monetize, at least, some of their work. Unfortunately, instead of being satisfied to #LETTHEAUDIENCEDECIDE, the editors of Medium clearly opted to shape what was exposed on the platform in their own image. Which meant if you didn’t fit their post-Millennial profile — at least as far as your writing goes — you didn’t get much promotion or exposure. Which, after all, is the name of the game, when you’re not collecting a fee for writing. Then, Medium promised they could fix all that with their pay-wall system which would enable writers who built their own individual readerships to monetize their work — at least to some extent. But unfortunately, the Medium pay-wall system works only to benefit Medium, not the writers who joined it, many if not most of whom are complaining loudly these days. So, to answer your question, I’m not writing for Medium anymore, at least, not much anymore. At the below listed link, you can read, if you care to, some of the best advice I’ve ever given about writing. Cheers! About Writing About Writing

Mainly for the simplicity and partner program. Medium lets pretty much any writer sign up for an account and start writing. Anyone can also sign up for their partner program and start earning money for the posts they write. You don’t to worry about writing advertiser-friendly content, or worry about keeping the site up to date and fast enough. There’s also the fact that it’s absolutely free, while having your own site requires you to pay for a domain and hosting at the very least.
